epics.title: File Upload Interface
epics.description: Develop a user-friendly drag-and-drop upload interface with file validation and progress tracking.

stories.title: Implement Drag-and-Drop Upload Zone
stories.description: Create a large drop zone with visual feedback for file uploads.
acceptance_criteria: Large drop zone with dashed border is present
Visual feedback on drag hover (border color change, background highlight)
Click to open file picker alternative is available
Displays file type icons based on extension

agent_context.goal: Enhance user experience by providing an intuitive file upload interface.
known_patterns: Use existing UI library for drag-and-drop
self_check: Does the interface support all required file types?
Is the drag-and-drop area responsive on different devices?

stories.title: Implement File Validation
stories.description: Validate files before upload for size, extension, MIME type, and malware.
acceptance_criteria: File size checked against limit (configurable per file type)
File extension validated against allowed list
Files scanned for malware using ClamAV
Clear error message shown for rejected files

agent_context.goal: Ensure only valid and safe files are uploaded to the system.
self_check: Are all file types correctly validated?
Does the malware scanning process introduce significant delays?

stories.title: Develop Progress Tracking UI
stories.description: Display upload progress with overall and individual file progress bars.
acceptance_criteria: Cancel button per file and for entire batch

agent_context.goal: Provide users with real-time feedback on their upload progress.
self_check: Is the progress bar accurate and responsive?

epics.title: Advanced File Upload Mechanisms
epics.description: Implement chunked upload and post-upload processing for large files.

stories.title: Implement Chunked Upload
stories.description: Enable chunked upload for large files with resume support.

agent_context.goal: Allow large files to be uploaded efficiently and reliably.
known_patterns: Use existing libraries for chunked uploads
self_check: Does the system handle network interruptions gracefully?

stories.title: Implement Post-Upload Processing
stories.description: Process files after upload, including thumbnail generation and metadata extraction.
acceptance_criteria: Preview generated for documents (first page as image)
OCR run on PDF/images if text extraction enabled
Files stored in CDN with geographic distribution

agent_context.goal: Enhance file usability and accessibility post-upload.
self_check: Are thumbnails generated for all image types?
Is metadata extraction accurate and comprehensive?

epics.title: Upload API and Security
epics.description: Develop a secure API for file uploads with comprehensive security measures.

stories.title: Develop Upload API
stories.description: Create endpoints for initiating, uploading chunks, completing, and managing uploads.
acceptance_criteria: All endpoints require authentication via API key or OAuth token

agent_context.goal: Provide a robust API for programmatic file uploads.
self_check: Are all endpoints secure and authenticated?
Does the API handle large file uploads efficiently?

stories.title: Implement Security Measures for Uploads
stories.description: Ensure security of file uploads with encryption, signed URLs, and rate limiting.
acceptance_criteria: Rate limit of 100 uploads per hour per user
All uploads virus scanned before availability

agent_context.goal: Protect the system and users from malicious file uploads.
self_check: Are encryption and decryption processes efficient?
Is the rate limiting correctly enforced?

epics.title: Storage and Integration
epics.description: Integrate with multiple storage backends and provide secure download links.

stories.title: Integrate with Storage Backends
stories.description: Support multiple storage backends and generate signed URLs for secure downloads.
acceptance_criteria: Support for AWS S3 as primary storage
Support for Google Cloud Storage as backup
Support for local filesystem in development

agent_context.goal: Ensure reliable and secure storage of uploaded files.
known_patterns: Use AWS SDK for S3 integration
self_check: Are signed URLs generated securely and correctly?
Is the integration with storage backends seamless?
